Is this a former Chernozem becoming a luvisol?  Young, dense Aspen stand - clump in middle of gently rolling grasslands.  Very few species in interior, but many at edge.  Wildlife - solitary vireo, pine siskin.  ON CARD: Site Type =  Aspen, Rosa woo, Symp alb; Map Sheet, Latitude and Longitude are blank;Biogeo Unit = middle grassland - BGxw2; Success. Status = early seral? - Aspen trees 6-10 cm diam and very dense;

Wildlife - WaVi, SoSp, RBNu.  Range - a few cow pies, but doesn't seem too disturbed.  Notes - Viol can present only in portions of stand, not evenly distributed.  Thick leaf litter prev D layer.  Mostly young aspen with a few old vets and some lg old aspen present as CWD.    ON CARD: Site Type = Aspen, shrub, pinegrass; Map Sheet, Latitude,  Longitude and Site History are blank; Success. Status = good;

Notes - Open aspen stand next to Stip ric site.  Not as shrubby as in middle grasslands with Juni instead of Rosa and Symp.  Litter 98%/3cm.   ON CARD: Map Sheet, Latitude and Longitude are blank; Site Type = Aspen, pinegrass, juniper; Nutrient Regime = medium-rich; Success. Status = fair-good - lots of dandelion; Site History = no recent cowpies;

Shrubby open Aspen type with less pinegrass; some Juni sco/com and scattered Fd.  Litter 60%/ 3cm.  Some cow paddies.   ON CARD: Map Sheet, Latitude and Longitude are blank; SiteType = Aspen / Rose; Meso Slope Pos = level-dep; Nutrient Regime = med-rich; Success. Status = fair-good; Site History = some grazing - lots of Tara off;

Climax with weeds; Old aspen stand with lots of disease, lots of sapsuckers feeding sign, next to Hardeum wetland.  Weeds scattered in this type.  Photo of the site and mountain chickadee cavity (no numbers given).  Wildlife - mtn chickadee, nuthatch.  ON CARD: Site Unit = Aspen - saskatoon - rose - symphoriocarpus - bluegrass;  Map Sheet, Latitude, Longitude, Success. Status, and Site History are blank; Moisture Regime = shg+; Surface Substrate Dead Wood = 0.1%;

Dense Acer gla thicket where 4-5 fir were removed about 30 yrs ago.  Along ephimeral stream, no distinct streambed, all vegetated.  On cool slope above - grades to Fd, Sypm and Fd moss; and on warm aspect - grades to Arte tri, Elym spi, and Stipa com.  Rhus rad in type but not in plot.  ON CARD: Map Sheet, Latitude, and Longitude are blank; Site History = Some past selective logging;
NARROW (15+ m) RIPARIAN BETWEEN STEEP BANKS

Plot centred on older At.  Site in exclosure with no grazing for more than 2 years.  Litter %90.  ON CARD: Meso Slope Pos = slight DP; Site Disturbance = some trees cut several years ago; Success. Status = : MS
Poor condition aspen stand with few vets and lots of younger stems and some dead; not a very closed canopy.  Not a common type in IDFxk.
